interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Vampires
Review Date: 2014/06/01
Store: James Woods  (Actor),     Daniel Baldwin  (Actor),     John Carpenter  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'The future of mankind rests in the hands of Master Slayer Jack Crow as he moves to prevent the Master Vampire from reaching his ultimate goal for the legions of undead, the ability to walk in daylight.', 'Amazon.com', "Talk about an opening. The first few minutes of John Carpenter's", 'Vampires', '--in which James Woods\'s vampire killer leads a dawn raid on a New Mexico "goon nest" of bloodsuckers--not only suggests a horror movie that will not pull any punches, it even evokes some of the more disturbing dream-memories of American Westerns. Muscular and uncompromised, the sequence suggests a new Carpenter classic unraveling before one\'s eyes. Well, dream on. Things don\'t quite work out that way, but this is still a film to reckon with. There are a few serious (and surprising) misjudgments on the director\'s part, particularly a mishandling of Sheryl Lee\'s role as a prostitute poisoned by the bite of a "master vampire" (who pretty much wiped out Woods\'s team of goon terminators). But aside from some weaknesses, the action is jolting, the suggested complicity of the Catholic Church in destroying monsters is provocative, and the traces of Howard Hawks\'s continuing influence on Carpenter\'s storytelling are in evidence.', '--Tom Keogh']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Full Screen, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'James Woods, John Steakley, Mark Boone Junior, Tim Guinee, Don Jakoby, John Carpenter, Maximilian Schell, Thomas Ian Griffith, Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa, Henry Kingi, Sheryl Lee, Thomas Rosales Jr., Daniel Baldwin, David Rowden, Gregory SierraJames Woods, John Steakley, Mark Boone Junior, Tim Guinee, Don Jakoby, John Carpenter, Maximilian Schell, Thomas Ian Griffith, Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa, Henry Kingi, Sheryl Lee, Thomas Rosales Jr., Daniel Baldwin, David Rowden, Gregory Sierra  See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 48 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 0.7 x 5.4 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '43396030640', 'Director': 'John Carpenter', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Full Screen, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 48 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 9, 1999', 'Actors': 'James Woods, Daniel Baldwin, Sheryl Lee, Thomas Ian Griffith, Maximilian Schell', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Don Jakoby, John Steakley', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: "Hey Padre, got a little wood?". Certainly not everyones taste, but the mix of humor and action is good for me.
Review Title: One of my two favorite movies
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
The Dilemma [Blu-ray]
Vince Vaughn  (Actor, Producer),     Kevin James  (Actor),     Ron Howard  (Director, Producer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
["Vince Vaughn and Kevin James headline an all-star comedy from director Ron Howard. Ronny's (Vaughn) world is turned upside down when he inadvertently sees something he should not have, and makes it his mission to get answers. As the amateur investigation dissolves his world into comic mayhem, he learns that his best friend Nick (James) has a few secrets of his own. Now, Ronny must decide what will happen if he reveals the truth. Also starring Jennifer Connelly, Winona Ryder, Channing Tatum and Queen Latifah.", 'Bonus Content:', 'Deleted Scenes', 'Deleted Scenes', 'Gag Reel', 'Gag Reel', 'Improvs with Vince Vaughn and Kevin James', 'Improvs with Vince Vaughn and Kevin James', 'This is The Dilemma', 'This is The Dilemma', 'Tour Chicago', 'Tour Chicago', 'On Ice', 'On Ice', 'My Scenes', 'My Scenes', 'BD-Live', 'BD-Live', 'pocket BLU App', 'pocket BLU App', ']]>']

We are Kevin James (particularly) and Vince Vaughn (generally) fans. We really enjoyed this moving. It was fine for my teenager. It had a story line and some great actors to make it sing. People who like Hitch will definitely like this. King of Queens fans will like Kevin as well.
A great way to spend a few hours

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Favorite Genres:** Comedy; enjoys family-friendly content suitable for teenagers, but also exhibits an interest in genre-blending films that combine humor with action, such as horror-comedy.
- **Actor Preferences:** Strong preference for Kevin James and a general favor for Vince Vaughn. The user also appreciates performances by James Woods and Daniel Baldwin, suggesting an openness to explore similar actors in action-oriented roles.
- **Director Appreciation:** Shows interest in films by Ron Howard and also values the directing style of John Carpenter, indicating a broad appreciation for storytelling across different genres.
- **Viewing Experience:** Values engaging storylines, strong character performances, and humor. Enjoys films that can be appreciated during family movie nights and is receptive to action-infused narratives.
- **Film Characteristics:** Enjoys films with relatable dilemmas and comedic elements, including a blend of humor and action. Appreciates bonus content like deleted scenes and gag reels, enhancing the viewing experience.
- **Social Viewing:** Likely enjoys movies in a casual, social context, aligning with a preference for entertaining and lighthearted films, but also enjoys films with a more complex tone when humor is included.
- **Overall Sentiment:** Generally positive towards the films reviewed, with high ratings indicating satisfaction and enjoyment in the viewing experience, even for content that may not align with traditional family-friendly norms.
